Content.Text:
<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
<MYNAME>! <MYNAME>!!
<PAGE>
Wake up! Quickly!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
<WINDOW_EXCLAMATION_R>It...it's Madam Eda! She's...! Oh, I can't believe
this is happening! Hurry, we have to get to her
house.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Marian!

<FACE_MARIAN><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, come here and sit by Madam Eda
and listen to what she has to say, okay honey?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
How's she doing, Marian?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Oh...! Oh no...

<FACE_OTMAR><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
She did well to hold on this long. She said she
wanted to talk to <MYNAME>. We should let
her.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Y-yes...

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
<MYNAME>...? Is that you, dear?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
I'm so glad you could come. I wanted...one last
chance to talk with you.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
Ohoho... You always were such a sweet child.
I've lived a long, full life. I knew my time would
come someday.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
Please, don't look so sad. I'm so very glad I met
you, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
From the moment I laid eyes on you, I knew you
had all the makings of a great farmer.
<PAGE>
Those days I spent helping to train you were
some of the best I've had in a long time.
<PAGE>
It really reminded me of the years when my
children and I lived here together. Thank you...

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
Will you listen to an old woman's last request...?
<PAGE>
Once I'm gone...I'd like you to have my farm,
<MYNAME>.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
<MYNAME>, please. You should answer Madam
Eda.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
Thank you... Now, I have no regrets.
<PAGE>
Miss Veronica, I'll leave the rest in your hands.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
All right...

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SPECIAL>
Don't cry now...I had a happy life... And I'm glad
that, at the end, I'm surrounded by so many
beloved friends...
<PAGE>
Thank you... I truly...had...a wonderful...life...

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>
Madam Eda? Madam Eda! Marian, she's--!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Everyone...
<PAGE>
Earlier today, Madam Eda, who for decades has
given her all to help this town prosper, passed
into her final rest. 
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>Allow me, now, to make an announcement.
<PAGE>
In accordance with her wishes, Madam Eda's
farm will be passed on to <MYNAME>. 
<PAGE>
She asked this of me in her final minutes, as a
last request.
<PAGE>
She said she wanted to entrust the land she had
built up for so many years to the next generation
of promising farmers.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>She may be gone from our midst now, but I
believe that she is watching over us from up
above.
<PAGE>
Let us never forget to look out for one another
and be good to one another, so that a part of
Madam Eda will always live on in this town.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Now, let us join in prayer in thanks for Madam
Eda's life, and that she may rest in peace.
